_description: Grade scale definitions for UCID context scoring.

A.label: Excellent
A.description: Exceptional performance, meeting or exceeding all criteria in the evaluated context.

B.label: Good
B.description: Above average performance with minor areas for improvement.

C.label: Moderate
C.description: Satisfactory performance meeting basic requirements with notable improvement opportunities.

D.label: Limited
D.description: Below average performance with significant gaps in the evaluated criteria.

F.label: Poor
F.description: Failing to meet minimum requirements in the evaluated context.

high.label: High Confidence
high.description: Score based on comprehensive data with high reliability.

medium.label: Medium Confidence
medium.description: Score based on partial data with moderate reliability.

low.label: Low Confidence
low.description: Score based on limited data, interpret with caution.
